website_summaries.verdict: For indoor or outdoor use, bright yellow color plus glue attracts and trap fruit flies and other bugs.
pros: More natural alternative to harmful chemicals and pesticides, safe to use inside and around house
Odorless and vaporless, even suitable for organic farming
Come ready to use, waterproof, UV resistant, with durable adhesive
Don't need to replace until they are covered with bug pests
cons: Product can be somewhat messy/sticky to handle

customer_reviews.title: They really work!
customer_reviews.text: I have little gnats or some type of small fly in my plants at work. I set these up on a Friday, and on Monday the traps were full of dead gnats. They're a little tricky to handle and set up in the plant, because they're so sticky, but once they're set they work. The gnats are attracted to the yellow, land on it and are trapped in the sticky substance.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work !!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this "gnat" trap for about a week. I have approx. 10-15 gnats in the kitchen and thought this product would take care of the problem. I had 1 gnat land on the surface and watched him/her for a few mins. The gnat flew right off ! I thought he was stuck ! No other gnats landed on the surface. They just flew around it. If this didn't work I guess nothing will.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: A MUST if you have plants
customer_reviews.text: A MUST if you have plants! I love my household plants but the gnats drive me insane - these stickies help eliminate that problem! I had no idea just how many pesky things I had until I went to change out the ones I had after one week. They are extremely sticky, a little thicker could be a great thing but you just peel and stick in your soil. I added several all around my pots. Buy them - you will be glad you did! (Also, sprinkle some cinnamon on your soil).
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Gets rid of those pests and prevents bigger problems!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these! I use them on all my indoor plants. They’re essential to help you spot an insect problem with your plant! The purpose of these is to initially get rid of those flying annoyances right from the start before they multiply. If you have indoor plants definitely get these! Nobody likes those little annoying bugs flying around! If my review has helped you in any way, please click the "helpful" button below so that I know! If you have any questions feel free to ask! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Fungus gnats GONE
customer_reviews.text: Tried several remedies but unless you use something to kill the larvae AND the adult fungus gnats these jerks will keep coming back. I sprinkled food grade diatomaceous earth (handle with care) on my house plants. They seemed to be slowing but they were still around the house. Added these to a bunch of the plants and haven’t seen any flying since! I avoided buying these for so long because I didn’t think I’d like the look but you barely notice the flower shape ones under the plants leaves. Very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlinjane

customer_reviews.title: If you're having bug issues in the house then this is the product you need
customer_reviews.text: These little traps are excellent. Very happy I purchased these. I recently had a lot of gnats around the house hanging out by my fruit and my pet's cage. Pros: once a gnat gets stuck on these it's stuck for good. It was able to trap a significant amount of gnats. Very easy to set up, just make sure to keep it in a spot where your pets cant touch it. Cons: not really a con but try to avoid touching it directly. They are very sticky.
customer_reviews.author: YogurtisDelish

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done, great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have little sunflowers that I grew from a kit that came in a "bag". They grew perfectly, but also attracted TONS of ... I think they are called fungus gnats? I was considering throwing them away, but just couldn't bring myself to do it because they are so perfect. I tried these, staking them in the middle of the plant, and they substantially lowered the number of gnats. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Works alright, but man that packaging needs help
customer_reviews.text: Does what it’s supposed to do and is keeping my garden safe from nats and fruit flies. However the packaging arrived damaged and torn up as shown in the above pics. Almost looks like it was just tossed in a package and no care in the world was given. Not a big deal, but definitely reflects on the company as a whole.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived on time and as described. While I ...
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and as described. While I treated all of my plants with an organic insecticide before bringing them in for the winter, I still managed to bring a few pests in. These did the trick quickly and with virtually no effort on my part other than sticking them in the pot. My indoor plants have no flying or creepy crawly bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Thompson

customer_reviews.title: only for the dumbest of fruit fly gnats
customer_reviews.text: This is sticky plastic with no smell or other reason for gnats to go near it. We have tried lots of different options and these work the least. Maybe if you have thousands of gnats in a very small area of a kitchen and you cover the area with these things, then maybe you can put a dent of 20% gnat reduction in the overall population but outside of that problem, they don't work.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kepner

customer_reviews.title: Not effective at all
customer_reviews.text: We had a ton of flies in our kitchen due to all the massive amounts of warm wet weather. Only 2 flies actually were attracted to them. We then were using the stickies like regular fly swatters after taping chopsticks to them. When the stickies got filled up on both sides we did use real fly swatters. Not worth the money- cheap enough, but still disappointed in the effectiveness after a week.
customer_reviews.author: Reindeer

customer_reviews.title: Buying again! Love
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping and I'm already ordering more. Within minutes I got some that already had a bug. Overnight this one caught 5 already. Love this product! And this is a photo of how many a few of these caught in less than a week!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Banister

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work very well...
customer_reviews.text: I placed a total of eight of these around our town house near our drains and house plants. Out of about a dozen confirmed fruit flies, they’ve caught a total of two. I understand the bright color is supposed to attract the flea but despite these traps being scattered around my house they don’t seem to be attracting anything. Will update this review if something changes.
customer_reviews.author: M. R.

customer_reviews.title: Put it in the plants and watch it destroy the little fruit fly guys
customer_reviews.text: We had a horrible problem with Gnats/Fruit Flies in our house (ultimately caused by a maid hiding potatoes that rotted and created a troubling science experiment). I had tried all types of catchers, and none were successful. Read a couple of reviews for these stickies and within a week of placing them strategically around the house, there are no more of those critters around. I bought a second pack (just in case) but have yet to find a need for it. I completely and wholeheartedly endorse this product. When used correctly it works.
customer_reviews.author: BenzoJones

customer_reviews.title: Works surprising well in 10 days bugs gone
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought what is this a couple pieces of plastic in this little box how in the heck is that going to work there's adhesive on each one of the ten plastic fake flowers and you stick them in the pot or plant that has the problem and what's in a week or two all the bugs that here to it and die
customer_reviews.author: T K

customer_reviews.title: but am sure they would work beautifully there too
customer_reviews.text: These little sticky trap flowers are not only very effective, but cute too. They catch all the little flying critters, and are rather unobtrusive in the flower pots I put them in. I have them in the kitchen, and other places in the house. I have not put them outside, but am sure they would work beautifully there too. I am very glad I ordered these sticky flowers.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi

customer_reviews.title: These work great!
customer_reviews.text: The stickies work GREAT! I use them at home and at work! You can put them in a plant or hang them. If you've thought of hanging a fly strip but didn't because it's unsightly or in the way, this is a great alternative! I included a picture of one hanging and one in a planter. I highly recommend, and ordered more to share!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie MacPherson

customer_reviews.title: sticks to everything, including fingers
customer_reviews.text: These work well, but they are nearly impossible to jam into the soil without getting stuck all over your fingers. I opted to get my next batch from another company that uses little stakes instead... MUCH easier to use. But they do work, mine turned practically black with all the little flies and gnats they caught.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: DEATH TO FUNUS GNATS
customer_reviews.text: I had a fungus gnat infestation thanks to a houseplant I bought at a large home supply store. The adult gnats FLOCK to these! I have found that they work best when combined with some soil treatment such as nematodes and a soil cover but they are DEFINITELY necessary in the fight against those annoying little flies.... I put these in ANY new plant I bring into the home and it has stopped the invasion.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of gnat problems
customer_reviews.text: I used these for a while to get my gnat problem under control. They caught hundreds of them and eventually finished them off by bottom watering and never watering from the top till your gnat problem is gone
customer_reviews.author: Jon N.

customer_reviews.title: These gnats fooled me....not!
customer_reviews.text: You know how these pests are(Gnats). I have a lot of plants inside the house and started seeing UFO around me. I decided to try these strips and they are working! In about 24 hours that strip is full if them. Hopefully I can get rid of all of them.
customer_reviews.author: PR_Sea_ Breeze

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: I put several of the stickies around the house, on plants and on the fruit basket. It's summer now and there are several fruit flies around the house! I hate them! These stickies work!!! They are trapping the flies!
customer_reviews.author: Carolina S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.  Would definitely purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and wonderful customer service. The product works exactly like it is supposed to. It caught hundreds of fungus gnats in just the first couple days and now they have been almost totally eradicated. I had an issue with them when they were delivered and was contacted by the company and sent a new pack. The customer service was as good as it could be. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: caspersmom

customer_reviews.title: Great for catching fruit flies!!! Excellent..!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It works to catch fruit flies- Check fresh flowers they have fruit fly eggs.... Put a new yellow cut out...out caught even more
customer_reviews.author: CaroA

customer_reviews.title: IT DOESN'T WORK AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: Its crap. It doesn't attract anything. Its only glue on plastic. I put this outside next to a flood light that comes on at night for 2 days. Absolutely no bugs were stuck to it. It's a fraud product.
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY Banner

customer_reviews.title: Check periodically for stickiness!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these after I had repotted some houseplants and a plethora of gnats broke out. The gnats were literally everywhere all the time. After a few weeks of these in my pots, the gnats almost disappeared...but recently have found a couple plants uninhabited by sticky traps so they're making a return. I'll definitely be ordering more. I attached a picture of the first fly trap I used when I got these traps a couple months ago. It's covered in gnats. These work! Just make sure to check them periodically as the sticky factor eventually wears away and they won't catch more gnats after it's gone.
customer_reviews.author: Tennille Burton

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, just a little messy to pull-apart as the sticky had melted / moved, but nothing near the mess as most liquid traps cause. Scent / apple cider vinegar smell free too, yay! Within days they were almost completely black from the large amount of gnats that had been caught. Very satisfied, will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Molly B

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but makes a big difference
customer_reviews.text: Very sticky. It can be a little difficult to stick into the soil, but it will grab gnats for a couple weeks once it is in. I'm not convinced that being yellow helps, because I feel I've seen soil gnats fly right past it. Given that, it isn't 100% effective, since you have to wait for them to land on it, but it definitely helps. I started combining this with another treatment.
customer_reviews.author: TallDenverite

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and worked right away! We had little indoor plant flies and it attracted them immediately and helped reduce the problem we were having. The sheets are VERY sticky so be careful!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Work as expected
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work as expected. Tiny whiteflies and whatever else have seemed to cease since I put one of these in each plant pot. And getting them wet doesn't matter. It does not wash off the adhesive. However, they are incredibly thin and flimsy, making them a real pain to push into the pot soil without making a mess and ultimately getting adhesive on your hands.
customer_reviews.author: PlungerBaby

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY!
customer_reviews.text: Months of fruit fly's that must have blown in with one of the hurricanes. I've tried Everything to get rid of those beastly things. Love these sticky little things. I'm almost completely free of the little demons!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work at all!
customer_reviews.text: This product is not even close to what it describes on the website. I had many fruit flies at home last year and so ordered this product after much research. So far, only one fly stuck on the sticky trap. The flies never bothered going close to this. I figured out that prevention is the best cure and let my indoor plants really dry up before I watered them again. Since then I water the plants conservatively.
customer_reviews.author: baski

customer_reviews.title: They work!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for indoor plants. If bugs show up there caught immediately!
customer_reviews.author: Brookwood

customer_reviews.title: Useless in kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Have two of these. One I placed a few feet away from the little flies that gather on the orange peels in my kitchen garbage basket. The other I placed in the garbage basket. Not one of the flies has been caught by the traps
customer_reviews.author: Craig Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: These things work like a charm. I have a lot of house plants at home and at work. On occasion I'll get fruit flies or fungus gnats - can't tell which - but these things work like charm! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: They really work
customer_reviews.text: It really works. Easy to use and great results. In just a night I found more than 30 flies in 4 of these traps
customer_reviews.author: AVM

customer_reviews.title: No more fruit flies!
customer_reviews.text: Stickies attract those nasty fruit flies and look cute on the counter. They are easy to retrieve from the cellophane coverlet. I folded the base and inserted it in the hole on the lid of the compost can I keep near the sink.
customer_reviews.author: CAJ

customer_reviews.title: A gnant catcher for sure!
customer_reviews.text: Larger than I thought they would be but very effective at catching the adult fungus gnats. I actually knew I had some flying around but had no idea how many until I saw how many were plastered to these sticky traps! They were full of gnats within 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: They work! Took a while to get a gnat but after several weeks it’s clear they’re working!
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Black

customer_reviews.title: used in green house
customer_reviews.text: this is really good for flying insects I have it in my green house and IT DOES WORK the only reason I gave it 4 stars is because they are not enough of them in the package
customer_reviews.author: Dany

customer_reviews.title: Oops
customer_reviews.text: They are OK, but a pain to put on, I put them on the base, plant, and shill I's getting eaten by whitefly
customer_reviews.author: Chef John Murgo

customer_reviews.title: They Work!
customer_reviews.text: Placed in potted plant where I have several house plants set on kitchen window seal. From time to time I have gnats or fruit flys. It works and looks nice. Easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've purchased this item. They are very sticky and are great for getting rid of tiny little gnats. They attract the bugs, which are then trapped. Very sticky! Service was great!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Wasn’t sure how well they would work but they catch so many gnats. I have a lot of plants and now the gnats don’t bother me anymore! Definitely buying more
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Caught Zero Flies
customer_reviews.text: I put these traps in my kitchen to drive out some pesky fruit flies. Well, either the fruit flies were very clever or these traps do nothing. I assume it's the latter. They were up for weeks and they never caught a single fly. Waste of time and money! I suggest using vinegar and dish soap for the flies, a lot cheaper and more effective!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Always know what you’re buying
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work well at all won’t buy them again didnt catch not one bug
customer_reviews.author: Edie williams

customer_reviews.title: Only received one!!! But it worked.
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing a mixed review as there are two aspects to this item. It worked fantastically don't get me wrong however don't believe it when it says 10 pack, I only received one. ???? No idea why. Also it arrived and the sticky goo was everywhere in the package making it almost impossible to unpack. I would buy this product again but I'm definitely going to look from a different seller. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT work!
customer_reviews.text: Only useful if you feel like smacking the bugs with them. Also, the Bugs that do happen to land on it can crawl off within mins. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Bug catcher
customer_reviews.text: Works great stick on plants and catches lots of bugs
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: ... Yellow Dual Sticky Fly Traps for Fruit Flies are amazing!! Within a day there was a noticeable ...
customer_reviews.text: The Yellow Dual Sticky Fly Traps for Fruit Flies are amazing!! Within a day there was a noticeable reduction in fruit flies buzzing around my houseplants and within a few days, they were all stuck on the traps. I have tried other methods with mixed results. The sticky traps are effective and my go to solution now. I just ordered two more packs to have on hand for times that these annoying bugs return. I highly recommend this very effective product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Gnats no more.
customer_reviews.text: These sticky traps works so well. I'm new to having houseplants and unfortunately I'm getting those little flying knats. the sticky traps have caught so many of them. I will buy more soon.
customer_reviews.author: cah62

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: These are the best sticky traps I have used. They are very easy to manage because of the way they are packaged and they pull apart easily. I hung one and stuck one in a pot. They are versatile and after just a few days the gnat colony seems to be significantly diminished.
customer_reviews.author: Selah

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: These work great in my office! We had an outbreak of fungus gnats!
customer_reviews.author: Chandra Troxell

customer_reviews.title: It works fine for me it immediately catch some gnats
customer_reviews.text: update: It catches gnat pretty well as soon as i use it but I only received 5. However, the seller contacts me immediately and get some proper questions and solve the issue. Thanks is this really pack of 10 trap? I only see 5 of them from my package. It may say since sticky trap has two sides. It works fine for me it immediately catch some gnats.
customer_reviews.author: Sungbo

customer_reviews.title: They def work!
customer_reviews.text: These things work, i thought i had fruit flies in my indoor garden, turned out to be fungus gnats. I started with the sugary coffee method, which works very well btw, and then added these, within 48 hours ive probably killed 75% of the gnats. If you have lil flying bugs in your greenhouse or indoor tent, dont let them kill your crop, get these asap.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Works so far
customer_reviews.text: Although I have had the product only a week, it has helped w/a white fly infestation I have on my lenten roses. Product is actually quite cute in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORKS LIKE MAGIC!
customer_reviews.text: Kills gnats without nasty pesticides as gnats are attracted to yellow, they stick, they die! Great product, highly suggest it for you too!
customer_reviews.author: AMAZINGZON

customer_reviews.title: No more swatting
customer_reviews.text: Pesky tiny flies that annoyed us for months were swiftly eliminated with the purchase of this product. I can not believe we had days of constant contests to kill those pests and within a few days we were fruit fly free. GREAT PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Floria

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT !
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT IS TERRIBLE AND SHOULD BE REMOVED FROM SELLERS. THE ONLY SERFACE IT ADHERES TO ARE ONES FINGERS. FR.D MARIE
customer_reviews.author: Fr.Damien Marie DeLourdes

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I put them in my plants and they’ve picked up lots of gnats
customer_reviews.author: Sandra E. Simon

customer_reviews.title: wouldn't attract fruit flies even when we stuck banana on it
customer_reviews.text: Might work for other flies, but not fruit flies, in our experience
customer_reviews.author: Joan M. Hess

customer_reviews.title: Product does catch small insects like gnats or fruit flies
customer_reviews.text: Product does catch small insects like gnats or fruit flies. However the group of 10 is all stuck together and not easy to separate, and it is quite likely that two make stick together reducing the apparent supply.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Rogalski

customer_reviews.title: Best of this product.
customer_reviews.text: These are great as they do not need to be put together and they are attractive and super sticky. So easy to use. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Joan M. Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Within a week they were pretty full of bugs
customer_reviews.text: These helped a lot. Within a week they were pretty full of bugs. Kept them from multiplying. It took placing them in several plants. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: Effective and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Very effective in 24 hours of placing in my household plants. I will definitely buy more if I have problems with those darn little gnats in the house again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are great to show how bad your gnat problem is
customer_reviews.text: These are great to show how bad your gnat problem is. It also helps stop the breeding cycle which helps with getting rid of the gnats. I recommend using with a soil treatment to kill the eggs & larvae.
customer_reviews.author: Brisco

customer_reviews.title: Gnat for nothin.
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping these would help with a large number of gnats that were in our grass. It caught a few but basically did nothing to reduce them in any meaningful way. We placed out all traps and most had no gnats caught after a week.
customer_reviews.author: Royland

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, small in size.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, small in size. works well. But have to be careful when kids around.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Inserted as Instructed.
customer_reviews.text: We inserted the sticky fly traps to combat gnats and fruit flies following the enclosed instructions, and so far have no pests have hit the sticks. Will update after giving the stuff time to work the advertised magic.
customer_reviews.author: cadet

customer_reviews.title: Works on Adult Fungus Gnats Only!
customer_reviews.text: The stickies work at catching adult fungus gnats, but beware, they will not kill the larvae in the soil. You will need something else to completely rid yourself of the gnats.
customer_reviews.author: bitterhusk

customer_reviews.title: Little larger than the picture.
customer_reviews.text: I love these.Fungus gnats stuck on them within 5 min Wish they gave you more then 10 in a package tho.Kinda pricey!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen R.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: We are having a real problem in NC with gnats this summer. I ordered these with hopes of catching them...I have had them hanging over a week and have caught a total of 2 gnats after hanging up three of them in my kitchen. They do NOT work!!
customer_reviews.author: J Holley

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money don’t work
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money didn’t even catch one bug/fly or Kant.
customer_reviews.author: Joyfulhemp4u

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: This product is being returned. The adhesive on these is all over the bases as well as the flower shaped tops, so you can't get them apart or use them. I have used other brands available on Amazon and have had no issues. I do not recommend his item.
customer_reviews.author: losingforlife3

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: These trapped flies. I ordered a different type right after these and the different type did not work as well at attracting flies. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly N.

customer_reviews.title: They do what they're supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: These stickies work.. they do what they are supposed to do. I was looking for somethimg to keep the bugs away from this 1 bush we have... although the stickies catch the bugs there are too many bugs for these stickies.
customer_reviews.author: J. B.

customer_reviews.title: Best fly traps ever
customer_reviews.text: These little things are awesome. I can't believe how many flea beetles and other bugs were caught in my garden by these little fly traps. What a great product.
customer_reviews.author: justme

customer_reviews.title: Like a magnet!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG these are fricken amazing! I am about to order my second pack. My mom recommended these to me and she uses them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, impossible to insert
customer_reviews.text: flimsy, impossible to insert in soil without getting the soil all over the trap, and the trap chemical all over your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Charles DeGaul

customer_reviews.title: Works for plants
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this in my kitchen to get rid of some gnats flying around the sick and it caught a few. Personally, I prefer the apple cider vinegar method. I think this product works better for house plants.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Very sticky- good to catch fungus gnats
customer_reviews.text: Did not cure my problem of fungus gnats but caught lots of them!
customer_reviews.author: julie segner

customer_reviews.title: Expensive junk
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of money ... over priced and useless product. These are small stuck together and your hands get all jammed up trying to pry them apart.
customer_reviews.author: kljourney

customer_reviews.title: Will work if placed in the right spots
customer_reviews.text: These things definitely work once you figure out where they are most needed. I also had to let my plants dry out after using an insecticide soil additive but these stickies got the rest.
customer_reviews.author: WestieloverTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Gross but I'm glad I finally invested in these
customer_reviews.text: Works well against gnats. I caught so many on the sticky traps, I was surprised to find out how many gnats were living in the soil of my houseplants. Gross but I'm glad I finally invested in these!
customer_reviews.author: Frances Logan

customer_reviews.title: These actually work really well! We were a little ...
customer_reviews.text: These actually work really well! We were a little skeptical but we had two identical plants and used these on one of them, and the other one without it died.
customer_reviews.author: azia

customer_reviews.title: WORKS FOR ME
customer_reviews.text: These began working instantly, collecting the swarm of fungus gnats I unknowingly transplanted with herbs that live all summer in the garden and come in for the winter . Maybe the stickies will attract fruit flies next summer?
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: They work good.
customer_reviews.text: So low tech. So cute. So effective! Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: DougLB

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: These things don't work at all. Put it in a rather small room with lots of gnats - didn't catch a single one in days - still waiting to work. Terrible product. Don't bother!
customer_reviews.author: Marco Navarro

customer_reviews.title: These are a fantastic product. I so prefer not using the spray ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a fantastic product. I so prefer not using the spray solutions and this takes care of the fruit flies without breathing dangerous chemicals.

customer_reviews.text: Catches everything, beyond expectation, and leaves sticky residue on hand. I don't like the sticky residue on hand but love how it catches all the bugs.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: These work great for taking care of the pesky gnats that come with having house plants. They are easy to use, although a bit messy. It's impossible to peel them apart and stick them in the dirt without getting your figures a little sticky. But, not a huge deal.

customer_reviews.title: Gnat free and no chemicals
customer_reviews.text: I love this and it works very well for soil gnats that you often get when buying a plant from a store. My favorite part.... totally organic. No chemicals!

customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good gnat trap and this is not the product for you if you have a gnat problem. Once they land on it I've seen them escape from the not so sticky traps.
customer_reviews.author: Leahphant

customer_reviews.title: Great sticky traps
customer_reviews.text: My tomatoes got infected with white fly and were in bad shape put sticky fly traps in and wow what a difference they made in a couple days my plants are once again doing well . These traps are easy to install and most important they don't hurt my dogs. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: catherine a batz

product_meta.title: Yellow Dual Sticky Fly Traps (10 Pack) for Fruit Fly Gnat Whiteflies Fungus Gnats Small Insects Houseplant Eco Friendly 21C Save A Garden Flower Shape
product_meta.description:
Save-a-Garden is the New Generation of Insect Traps with a decorative design.

They contain no pesticides and are safe to use indoors and outdoors. Now you can protect your plants from flying insects that feed on their leaves and roots, trap them and stop the infestation without harmful chemicals.

How do they work?

Small insects are attracted by the bright yellow color. Once they land, the glue on both sides will trap them and they won't be able to escape!

Very easy to use

Separate the traps by lifting the end of triangular plastic base. If some adhesive gets on your hand, remove with vegetable oil (or any type of oil) and wash with soap and water, or simply use disposable gloves to avoid contact.

Place them directly into the pot, or hang them from trees or larger plants by inserting twist ties in the punched holes. Each trap comes with its own wire tie.

Use them for Whiteflies, aphids, gnats, fruit flies, fungus gnats, mosquitoes, thrips, leaf miners, leafhoppers, moths, sciarid flies, lepidoptera, diptera, nematodes, olive tree flies.

Traps are ideal for flowers and vegetables, balconies, gardens, orchards, greenhouses etc...

Backed by 21 Century Solutions 100% satisfaction guarantee or your money back! If you have any issues with your Stickies please contact us and we will get the problem solved ASAP!
feature_bullets: EXTREMELY EFFECTIVE BUG CATCHER INDOORS AND OUTDOORS. Attract and trap fungus gnats, fruit flies, whiteflies, gnats, etc...The bright yellow color and the glue will draw in flying insects, trap them, control infestation and break the breeding cycle.
NATURAL PEST CONTROL. They are a great alternative to chemicals and pesticides, and safe to use inside and around your house. No vapor, odorless and allowed in organic farming.
READY AND EASY TO USE. Just peel them apart by lifting the end of the triangular base and stick the traps into the soil, or hang them using the twist ties.
LONG LASTING. With a very strong adhesive on both sides, they are UV resistant and waterproof. No need to replace them until fully covered with bugs.
CONVENIENT PACK OF 10. You get 10 cute yellow sticky traps and 10 twist ties. Flower shape 5" x 3.5".
